image.altText: A composite image of a digital avatar headshot next to a close up image of a man.

items.synopsis: We’re entering a new era of artificial intelligence, where human-like conversation and images can be created with the click of a button. Already, the powerful technology is changing our lives — for better or worse.

title.children: Alexander's loving 'wife' lives inside an app. He says she's exactly what he needs

image.altText: APRA Grenfell St 2

items.synopsis: The federal government spends around $650 billion a year. Where some of it goes will surprise you.

title.children: Morrison government gave $380,000 to social media company that also makes explicit content

image.altText: Jock takes a selfie with the other judges.

items.synopsis: Tributes flow for celebrated chef Jock Zonfrillo ahead of the debut episode of the new season of MasterChef Australia.

title.children: 'Hard as nails but vulnerable': Tributes flow for celebrated chef Jock Zonfrillo as MasterChef returns to air

image.altText: A woman sits in a room atop a suitcase and surrounded by other paperwork and memories

items.synopsis: Beth Heinrich has spent 30 years fighting for justice over what happened to her as a teenager. Memories of her shattered life are locked away in a suitcase. But she’s not ready to throw it away just yet.

title.children: Beth's haunting past lies in a suitcase, but she's not ready to throw it away just yet

image.altText: People speaking outside court with one holding a placard reading 'truth will win in the end'

items.synopsis: Sovereign citizens don't believe the laws apply to them, so they challenge any punitive measures in court. A NSW magistrate warns this is having serious consequences for everyone.

title.children: A 300-page response to a parking fine: Why sovereign citizens are straining the local court systems

image.altText: A girl waves a British flag in a large crowd. She is wearing a blow up crown.

items.synopsis: King Charles and Queen Camilla join big crowds at Windsor Castle for the coronation concert, while people across the UK also gather together to celebrate at home. Follow live.

title.children: King Charles introduced as 'artist formerly known as prince' at coronation concert

schema.headline: King's coronation concert live updates: 20,000 gather to watch star-studded line-up

liveBlogUpdate.headline: The royal children are having a great time
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Princess Charlotte, in particular, appears to be loving the performances. Prince Louis isn't at the concert but I just know he's dancing along at home.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Landmarks across the UK light up
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: There are celebrations across the UK and landmarks are being lit up across the region as Paloma Faith performs Lullaby. I'll bring you some photos as soon as I can.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Prince William addresses the crowd
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Unfortunately, we won't be getting a performance out of Prince William, but he has some words to share about his father. "As my grandmother said when she was crowned, coronations are a declaration of our hopes for the future," he says. He says the late Queen Elizabeth would be a proud mother this weekend. King Charles has dedicated himself to serving others, Prince William says. 'Pa, we're all so proud of you," he says. Princess Charlotte is watching on excitedly in the crowd. The crowd recites "God save the King" after Prince William.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: A standing ovation for Lionel Richie
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The Royals are on their feet to cheer on LIonel Richie, even King Charles himself.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Lionel Richie takes to the stage
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: It's easy like a Sunday morning for Lionel Richie, who is sitting in front of a piano in this stripped-back performance. Next up he's ditched the instrument to sing All Night Long.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: King Charles 'the artist formally known as Prince'
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: In his introduction earlier, Hugh Boneville joked that King Charles was the artist formally known as Prince. Here's how it was received by the king himself:

liveBlogUpdate.headline: We can expect a few collabs too
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: A number of collaborative performances are scheduled, including Italian opera star Andrew Bocelli, who will perform a duet with Welsh bass-baritone Sir Bryn Terfel. Self-proclaimed lifelong monarchist Steve Winwood, of Traffic, Blind Faith and Spencer Davis Group fame, will perform alongside a virtual choir as well as a spoken-word performance by Bollywood actress Sonam Kapoor. Nicole Scherzinger of the Pussycat Dolls and pianist Lang Lang will perform together, while London singer-songwriter Freya Ridings will perform with composer and pianist Alexis Ffrench. Among others confirmed to perform are Olly Murs, Paloma Faith and Tiwa Savage.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Miss Piggy and Kermit are late to the concert
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Nigerian singer Tiwa Savage has just performed Keys to the Kingdom and now the show is being interrupted by Miss Piggy and Kermit the Frog. Miss Piggy's looking for a way to marry a lord so that she can become a lady.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Bring me a higher love!
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: There's now a performance of Higher Love from Steve Winwood recognising all of the commonwealth countries. The massive crowd is having a ball. Of course, we Aussies got a little recognition in this performance.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Katy Perry and Lionel Richie are among a line-up of international performers
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: According to Town and Country magazine, acts to take part are pop star Katy Perry, who turned heads at the coronation ceremony on Saturday in her pink outfit, as well as fellow American singer Lionel Richie. Nineties UK boy band Take That are the biggest British pop stars to be confirmed for the event. Band members Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen are all scheduled to perform their first live show since 2019 in front of Windsor Castle. However, we're not yet sure whether former Take That member Robbie Williams is set to entertain.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: Rapid-fire performances
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: We've just heard from the Coronation Choir and then pianist Lang Lang took the stage. Mr Lang, no stranger to prestigious events including the Queen's Diamond Jubilee, said the evening would be really special "like a fairytale." "To play in front of this Windsor Castle it's a really big honour. And especially this is a special moment," he said. Performances are moving quickly, Nicole Scherzinger is now performing a version of Christina Agulera's Reflection.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: There are huge crowds at Windsor Castle
Olly Murs takes the stage
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: The concert kicked off with a performance of Rudimental's Feel The Love. We're now hearing from actor Hugh Bonneville who is introducing Olly Murs to the stage who will perform Dance With Me tonight.

liveBlogUpdate.headline: King Charles has arrived for his coronation concert
liveBlogUpdate.articleBody: Good morning, welcome to our live coverage of the King's coronation concert and celebrations across the UK. More than 20,000 people have arrived at Windsor Castle to watch a star-studded lineup including Lionel Richie and Katy Perry. King Charles and Queen Consort have taken their seats, so let's get started.

liveBlogStreamPrepared.name: King's coronation concert live updates: 20,000 gather to watch star-studded line-up

liveBlogPostPrepared.title: King Charles has arrived for his coronation concert

props.alt: The royal family stand waving in front of a crowd.

children.content: (Reuters: Chris Jackson)
Good morning, welcome to our live coverage of the King's coronation concert and celebrations across the UK.
More than 20,000 people have arrived at Windsor Castle to watch a star-studded lineup including Lionel Richie and Katy Perry.
King Charles and Queen Consort have taken their seats, so let's get started.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Unfortunately, we won't be getting a performance out of Prince William, but he has some words to share about his father. "As my grandmother said when she was crowned, coronations are a declaration of our hopes for the future," he says. He says the late Queen Elizabeth would be a proud mother this weekend. King Charles has dedicated himself to serving others, Prince William says. 'Pa, we're all so proud of you," he says. Princess Charlotte is watching on excitedly in the crowd. The crowd recites "God save the King" after Prince William.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Prince William addresses the crowd

children.content: Unfortunately, we won't be getting a performance out of Prince William, but he has some words to share about his father.
"As my grandmother said when she was crowned, coronations are a declaration of our hopes for the future," he says.
He says the late Queen Elizabeth would be a proud mother this weekend.
King Charles has dedicated himself to serving others, Prince William says.
'Pa, we're all so proud of you," he says.
Princess Charlotte is watching on excitedly in the crowd.
The crowd recites "God save the King" after Prince William.

image.altText: King Charles looks out of the rain-spattered window of a carriage

items.synopsis: The coronation is done and dusted, but the spectacle has reignited debates about slavery, colonial legacies and republicanism.

title.children: With the coronation over, King Charles faces a racial reckoning

image.altText: A smiling woman with blond hair wearing a dark jacket and green top stands outside.

items.synopsis: The $14.6 billion package over the forward estimates includes $1.5 billion in electricity bill relief for more than 5 million households and a further 1 million small businesses.

title.children: Electricity bill relief receives mixed reviews as federal government reveals $14.6b cost of living package

image.altText: A composite image of Vladimir Putin, Xi Jinping and Joe Biden

items.synopsis: It was a magnificent sunny spring morning in Ukraine's capital, when Chinese President Xi Jinping deigned to finally speak to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, writes John Lyons in Kyiv.

title.children: China is making its move in Ukraine, and the US has no chance of matching it

image.altText: A cartoon illustration of a light-skinned hand holding a small, white IUD and a dark-skinned hand holding a small, copper IUD.

items.synopsis: Doctors call for a network of dedicated IUD insertion clinics that could present a solution to one of the key challenges in the federal government's national women's health strategy.

title.children: There are many barriers to inserting IUDs — doctors say insertion clinics might just solve a number of problems

image.altText: SU-35 jet performs at international air show

items.synopsis: A Russian fighter jet has intercepted a Polish plane over the Black Sea, causing the pilots to temporarily lose control of the aircraft, according to Warsaw.

title.children: Russian fighter pilots accused of 'dangerous manoeuvres' near Polish aircraft over Black Sea

image.altText: Five large luminescent green mushrooms against a black backdrop.

items.synopsis: Recent wet weather is spurring a flurry of mushroom growth including in luminescent varieties that are delighting nature lovers.

title.children: Tisha has walked the same track for 20 years. This is the first time she has spotted ghost mushrooms

image.altText: people standing outside an apartment block waiting to view it as a rent sign stands on the footpath

items.synopsis: The New South Wales government is prioritising changes to the rental bond system and secret bidding as parliament resumes this week, but that is not the relief many tenants are desperate for.

title.children: Rent caps not on the cards in NSW despite median Sydney weekly rent surpassing $700

image.altText: A composite image of Jake Lever, Adam Simpson and Charlie Dixon

items.synopsis: Round eight proves the season will be defined by a series of thrillers, while West Coast's road back to relevance looks like being a long one. We digest the week that was.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Demons and Power thrive on fine margins, Eagles left to ponder what's next

image.altText: Melanie Morris and her nine year-old daughter, Kaitlyn Morris 1

items.synopsis: Melanie Morris vividly remembers the sense of searing anger as she held her sick toddler in her arms in the emergency department of Launceston's general hospital for the fourth time in a week, back in 2015. Years on, the question is — are things getting any better?

title.children: A preventable death at Launceston's hospital brings back terrible memories for Melanie

image.altText: South Sydney players embrace in celebration as a flame shoots up in front of a scoreboard saying 'TRY' in the background.

items.synopsis: As the NRL carnival moves away from Brisbane and back to regularly scheduled programming, we look at the winners and losers from Magic Round.

title.children: The complexion of the NRL's premiership race completely changed over three days in Brisbane

image.altText: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen of the Netherlands steers his car through a corner.

items.synopsis: If Sergio Perez scores seven more points than Max Verstappen, he will become just the second Mexican driver to lead the F1 championship.

title.children: Max Verstappen leads with teammate Sergio Perez chasing on different strategy

image.altText: A tall black person with black hair and garish makeup wears high heels and a leopard print bikini against a yellow background

items.synopsis: The LA-based photographer and activist, famous for turning a spotlight on queer experience in America, discusses five of her key works, from the 90s to today.

title.children: From BDSM dungeons to the White House: The incredible journey of photographer Catherine Opie

image.altText: An image from high up of a forest area with large plumes of smoke rising up from it, on the bottom right a lot of orange flames.

items.synopsis: Alberta announced a state of emergency on Saturday as wildfires flared across the Canadian province, forcing 25,000 people to flee their homes in what a top official said was an "unprecedented" crisis.

title.children: Alberta announces state of emergency as 25,000 flee out-of-control wildfires in western Canada

image.altText: Lance Franklin carries the ball for Sydney Swans against Collingwood in front of a big stadium crowd

items.synopsis: AFL great Lance Franklin became the latest star player to be booed by opposition fans, leaving Sydney coach John Longmire bemused and Collingwood counterpart Craig McRae nonplussed.

title.children: 'Doesn't make sense': Sydney Swans' AFL great Lance Franklin booed by Collingwood fans

image.altText: RBA building

items.synopsis: Is the argument about profits and inflation finally settled, asks Gareth Hutchens.

title.children: Profits haven't contributed to inflation? Former treasury economist says it's not that simple

image.altText: A woman feeding grass to a black pig

items.synopsis: People in some parts of Queensland are being warned to brace for cold weather this week as gusty winds blow in from the south — with a special warning for farmers with young livestock.

title.children: Livestock warning as parts of Queensland tipped to shiver this week

image.altText: A tight shot of Jim Chalmers head, he wears a suit and red tie stands in front of a blue curtain

items.synopsis: In this week's federal budget, up to $500 in assistance will go to millions of households to help pay energy bills as part of a wide-ranging cost of living package.

title.children: Millions to receive up to $500 in energy bill relief as Treasurer flags broader cost of living support

image.altText: Aboriginal elder with beard and hat in front of the UN Headquarters.

items.synopsis: The winds of change brought Leslie Schultz to New York to attend a UN forum on Indigenous issues. Now the First Nations leader is turning his attention to securing a Voice to Parliament in Australia.

title.children: Indigenous elder finds voice at United Nations, while pushing for Voice to Parliament at home

image.altText: Emergency workers stand in front of a stretcher with large red plastic sheet blocking view as shoes lay, scattered, on road.

items.synopsis: At least seven people have been killed and several others injured after a car ran into pedestrians near a migrant and homeless shelter in Brownsville, Texas.

title.children: Man arrested after seven pedestrians killed by car on US-Mexican border

image.altText: Bearded man in a hat and glasses smoking a joint.

items.synopsis: There is always something in the air around Nimbin during the annual Mardi Grass Festival, but this year it's combined with a sense of optimism.

title.children: Michael's medical weed is legal, but he's at Nimbin's Mardi Grass Festival to push for further cannabis reform

image.altText: A drum with contents inside buried in dirt.

items.synopsis: Two men are arrested following an alleged drug operation involving a drum buried in bushland, where cash and cocaine were allegedly deposited.

title.children: Police seize $1.5m in cocaine after man observed allegedly trying to bury drugs near Darwin CBD

image.altText: Woman holding a sword upright in front of two men and a boy

items.synopsis: Everyone wants to make a lasting impression at the first coronation in 70 years. Here's who wore what to the ceremony.

title.children: Take a look at some of the outfits on display at King Charles's coronation

image.altText: Three Ukrainian soldiers walk along a track as sunlight streams in from the horizon

items.synopsis: In the lush greenery of central Ukraine's dense forests, members of the National Guard train for Ukraine's long-awaited campaign that they hope will shift the momentum of its war with Russia.

title.children: In Ukraine's forests, soldiers race to prepare for next push against Russian forces
